programme.title: Africa's Deadliest

programme.title: Africa's Deadliest
programme.desc: Africa‚Äôs jungles; mysterious wild worlds that hide some of the continent‚Äôs deadliest inhabitants. In the tangled canopy, predators lie in wait and every shadow conceals death. Survival means a constant battle against often unseen enemies. Life and death play out on a grand scale and every creature here has a role to play. Here, there‚Äôs plenty of space but no room for weakness. .

programme.title: India's Wild Leopards

programme.title: Africa's Deadliest
programme.desc: Vital to the survival of many species, waterholes draw large concentrations of animals seeking to quench their thirst. But these wildlife hotspots are anything but peaceful oases ‚Äî where there is water, Africa‚Äôs deadliest are often nearby.

programme.title: Lions: The Hunt For Survival
programme.desc: Three lionesses from three very different hunting arenas. Each face their own challenges, but all gun for one clear goal - to kill..

programme.title: America's Wild Spaces
programme.desc: Journey with JT Reynolds, Death Valley's larger-than-life superintendent, and meet the scientists who are working to protect this wild place as the mercury rises.

programme.title: America's Wild Spaces
programme.desc: Canyonlands is the little known jewel of the American national parks. But this rugged terrain is a more than a pretty picture; it is a history book of time. .

programme.title: Africa's Deadly Kingdom

programme.title: Queens

programme.title: Queens
programme.desc: In the heart of Tanzania, the towering walls of the Ngorongoro crater sets a stage for one of the most infamous rivalries in the natural world. The sisters of a formidable lion pride clash with a hyena clan ruled by an all-powerful queen. The sisterhood share responsibility, while the hyena queen must play clan politics and enforce a strict hierarchy to keep her crown.

programme.title: The Incredible Dr. Pol
programme.desc: The clinic is slammed with summertime cases as the vets battle to save a badly injured cat, a farm dog with a puncture wound, and a wobbling mini horse struggling to walk. The team is seeing double as pairs of ferrets and chickens come through the door. Doc and Dianes new puppy brings chaos and cuteness to the clinic.

programme.title: The Incredible Dr. Pol
programme.desc: The Fair is in full swing! Getting to this day took months of hard work from vets and kids to get the Fair animals in tip top shape. Even after the Fair opens, the vets are on call to treat any emergency that pops up. Dr. Pol treats a goat with a torn ear as Dr. Lisa examines a limping cow. At the clinic, Dr. Nicole is tireless in her effort to save the life of a beloved dog.

programme.title: The Incredible Dr. Pol
programme.desc: Armed with a bucket and tube, Dr. Pol works tirelessly to help a horse struggling with choke. Inside the clinic, Dr. Lisa tackles the many maladies of Mushi the cat, and Dr. Brenda treats a fussy feline. Something odd happens when Doc meets another DocDr. Strange the steer. Charles is worried about his dog Athena and looks to his dad for guidance. .

programme.title: Secrets Of The Octopus
programme.desc: Octopus are like aliens on earth but they have one superpower that we are only now beginning to fully appreciate. By changing their color hundreds of times an hour, or transforming the shape of their bodies to mimic their deadliest enemies, octopus are the most extraordinary shapeshifters on the planet.

programme.title: Secrets Of The Octopus
programme.desc: Octopuses break all the rules on animal intelligence. Born into the world as orphans, they are self-taught masterminds; capable of solving complex problems, strategizing, even planning for the future. Extraordinary superpowers that are the secret to their success.

programme.title: Secrets Of The Octopus
programme.desc: Octopuses were always thought to be natures ultimate loners, preferring their own company. The truth is they have secret social lives. From moms to be hanging out in the deep in their hundreds to an octopus capable of coworking with another species. These aliens of nature are more sociable than ever imagined.

programme.title: Secrets Of Wild India: Kings Of The Jungle
programme.desc: India is an extraordinarily diverse country, sharing its landscape between one fifth of the world's population and a spectacular wildlife. .

programme.title: Supersized Sharks
programme.desc: Has a small island in the middle of the South Pacific become a drive-thru burger joint for the world‚Äôs largest Tiger Sharks? Luring the giants to their boat, shark biologists Lauren Meyers, Charlie Huveneers and Adam Barnette investigate and are surprised to discover that beef is not the only unusual item on the menu.

programme.title: Tree Climbing Lions
programme.desc: Big cat biologist Alexander Braczkowski is on a mission. He's got 90 days to count lions in Uganda and learn how the population is doing. But these aren't ordinary lions. The prides in Queen Elizabeth National Park spend most of their lives up in the trees, a rare and mysterious behavior unique to this part of Africa. .

programme.title: Lion Warrior
programme.desc: This is the story of the survival of the Maasai-land lion. Under Africa's iconic Mt Kilimanjaro, lives one of the world's most romanticized tribes; the Maasai, who are in a real-time 'life and death' struggle with the world's most beloved big cat: the lion.

programme.title: Lion Dynasty
programme.desc: Our unique story spans a decade and follows one of Tanzania‚Äôs most powerful lion prides as they overcome mounting obstacles by relying on strong family bonds. programme.title: America's Wild Spaces

programme.title: Diary Of A Teen Leopard
programme.desc: Pemba is a Mamma's Boy! At two-years old, he should be independent, but he's still living at home! Like most teenagers, he's impatient and headstrong, which makes him bad at stalking and hunting, so Mom provides all their meals. But when Mom is injured Pemba is forced to grow up fast in order to survive! Can he sever those apron strings and face his fears to launch into adulthood?.

programme.title: Wild Transylvania: Dracula'S Hidden Kingdom
programme.desc: Dracula‚Äôs Transylvania lair is brimming with amazing wildlife. Shielded by the Carpathian Mountains, it‚Äôs a pristine wonderland that remains unchanged since the Middle Ages. Home to 26 species of bats, his kingdom is truly a night flyer‚Äôs paradise. Chamois, cuckoos, Ural owls, wild boar, lynx, brown bears, and huge wolf packs also thrive in a natural world beyond Bram Stoker‚Äôs imagination.

programme.title: The Incredible Dr. Pol
programme.desc: The staffers become the clients as they bring in their pets for the vets to treat. programme.title: Equator's Wild Secrets
programme.desc: Seven hundred miles off the coast of Ecuador lies a collection of volcanic islands that harbor some of the strangest living things to ever exist. These are the Galapagos Islands.Emerging from beneath the ocean more than 20 million years ago, life here has evolved in isolation to give rise to an astonishing variety of creatures, many found nowhere else on the planet. .

programme.title: Equator's Wild Secrets
programme.desc: Two islands are the last strongholds for Southeast Asia's rainforests. Borneo and Sumatra each harbor some of the most unique yet elusive species on Earth. From pygmy elephants to giant trees, flying lizards to swinging red apes, the battle for space influences all. .

programme.title: Equator's Wild Secrets
programme.desc: The Equator runs two thousand five hundred miles across the great continent of Africa. The species that live here are as varied as its landscapes. Giant grazers and iconic carnivores dominate its arid grasslands while rare apes thrive in its rainforests. Here, floods follow famine year after year but the animals have adapted and evolved to make the most of their environments. This is equatorial Africa - cauldron of evolution.

programme.title: Equator's Wild Secrets
programme.desc: Coral reefs of the Asia-Pacific region are the richest on planet Earth. For the weird and wonderful creatures of the oceans rainforests, interdependence is key to survival.

programme.title: Equator's Wild Secrets
programme.desc: Intersecting the equator, the Ecuadorian Andes are a biodiversity hotspot where jungle dwellers live alongside alpine specialists, all uniquely adapted to survive the extremes of mountain-living.

programme.title: Hidden Wonders of Europe
programme.desc: Germany is Europe‚Äôs most populous nation. A land hewn by mighty rivers and cloaked in forest. In these wild spaces, nature is full of surprises. From the Bavarian mountains to the North Sea, over a third of the country is now protected. Huge Grey Seals battle to breed, Marmots and Squirrels flee aerial invaders, and elusive Lynx and Moose - once hunted out - re-assert their grip.

programme.title: Hidden Wonders of Europe
programme.desc: The parched lands of the Iberian Peninsula give rise to snow-covered peaks, expanses of rare cork oak, and Europe‚Äôs only fog forest. Unique habitats, where species found nowhere else on earth fight for survival. Male Iberian Ibex face-off over females, a whiskered tern chick braves predator-infested waters, and settling the score for the Macaques of Gibraltar calls for kidnap.

programme.title: Hidden Wonders of Europe
programme.desc: Europe‚Äôs ancient landscapes have virtually disappeared, but some stretches remain. A rich mosaic of habitats still cover the country of Poland. Lush forests, vast lowlands and mountain peaks all team with life. But the wildlife here has to fight to survive. Sea eagles battle over breakfast, seasoned hunters adapt to extreme conditions, and a crafty caterpillar pulls off the ultimate heist.
